title: Rockets surge into G7 as 'steady' VanVleet delivers
content: Fred VanVleet had 29 points, including a key four-point play to start the fourth quarter, and the Rockets kept their season alive by beating the Warriors 115-107 on Friday night to force a Game 7.

title: Battle-tested in Game 7s, Warriors 'ready to roll'
content: Despite Friday night's 115-107 loss to Houston, the Warriors expressed confidence because of their advantage in playoff experience, in particular their Game 7 experience.

title: Pop done coaching Spurs; Johnson takes over
content: Gregg Popovich is moving to a full-time role in the Spurs' front office, and Mitch Johnson will take over head coaching duties, the team announced Friday.

title: Tigers' Greene homers twice in 9th in MLB first
content: Riley Greene homered to open the top of the ninth inning and capped an eight-run outburst with a three-run shot to lead the Tigers to a 9-1 win over the Angels on Friday night.

title: Jets stick up for Hellebuyck after latest playoff dud
content: Jets star goaltender Connor Hellebuyck failed to finish his third straight game after allowing five goals on 23 shots in Friday's Game 6 loss in St. Louis.

title: Romero disrupts Garcia's plans in massive upset
content: Ryan Garcia's plans for a second showdown with Devin Haney took a massive hit Friday night, when Rolly Romero pulled off an upset in a unanimous decision.

title: Simms' No. 11 to stay retired amid Carter search
content: Phil Simms told longtime New York Daily News writer Gary Myers on Friday that he was "outvoted by his family" and his No. 11 will remain retired by the Giants and won't go to Abdul Carter.

title: Red Sox's Casas suffers 'significant' knee injury
content: Red Sox first baseman Triston Casas suffered what manager Alex Cora called a "significant" knee injury after he awkwardly fell near first base in the bottom of the second inning against the Minnesota Twins on Friday night.

title: üèà Inside the decision to draft Shedeur Sanders
content: Cleveland didn't have Sanders graded as an elite prospect, but saw him as a steal once he slid to Day 3.

title: What this monumental coaching change means for San Antonio
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: Which Braves are the REAL Braves?
content: No team has made the playoffs after starting 0-7, but Atlanta has played better since. Will that continue -- and will it be enough?

title: Handing out April grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Is your favorite team acing -- or flunking -- the early part of the 2025 season? We break it all down.

title: Why Peter DeBoer never loses a Game 7
content: How has the coach gone 8-0 in clinching scenarios? Here's what his players, his family and DeBoer himself say.

title: What the Lakers' early exit tells us about their future with Luka
content: In nearly every way, the Lakers were outclassed by the Wolves. And now, after a disappointingly early exit, their next task is even more important: selling Doncic that this first-round loss was merely an aberration.

title: Diggins 'changed our program': How Notre Dame became the pipeline for some of the WNBA's top guards
content: Eight Notre Dame guards, including 2013 draft pick Skylar Diggins, are expected to make 2025 WNBA rosters.

title: How Wrexham paid their way to promotion, and why the Premier League requires more than that
content: Wrexham's promotion might look miraculous, but it's actually a combination of factors that other Premier League hopefuls shouldn't try to replicate.

title: NBA draft asset rankings: Where OKC's treasure trove and all 30 teams check in
content: Who controls the 2025 NBA draft? What about the next seven? Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo examine every team's draft future.

title: In its spell as F1 host, Miami has become America's Monaco
content: A good F1 venue goes beyond on-track action, and when it comes to spectacle and fun, Miami is second to none.

title: Fatherhood, a decade in F1 give Verstappen perspective on what's important
content: Max Verstappen's role as a dad isn't the only reason for his increasingly elder-statesman status in F1.

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: Exiting De Bruyne: 'Shown I can still play here'
content: Kevin De Bruyne said he proved he "can still play here" after the departing Manchester City midfielder scored a vital winning goal in his team's quest to qualify for next season's Champions League.

title: Slot reveals Klopp message after Prem title win
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has revealed his predecessor J√ºrgen Klopp reached out to congratulate him after his team won the Premier League title.

title: Madrid or Leverkusen? Alonso says 'we must wait'
content: Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso said we must wait until the end of the season for an announcement on his future amid links to Real Madrid.

title: Conte: McTominay better now than at Man United
content: Napoli manager Antonio Conte said Scott McTominay has become a more complete and knowledgeable player since joining from Manchester United last summer.

title: Paris FC join PSG in Ligue 1 for 1st time in 46 yrs
content: Paris FC will be back in action in the French top flight next season following an absence of 46 years after they secured promotion to Ligue 1 on Friday following a 1-1 draw at Martigues.

title: Wrexham boss: 'Legends' Mullin, Palmer to stay
content: Wrexham boss Phil Parkinson has confirmed that "legends" Paul Mullin and Ollie Palmer remain a part of the club's plans for next season.

title: Mascherano: Miami 'clearly Messi-dependent'
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano laughed off suggestions his team was too dependent upon Lionel Messi and insisted they will bounce back stronger when they host New York Red Bulls in MLS action following a tough CCL elimination.

title: Flick on Yamal: Hard work to top Messi, Ronaldo
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said on Friday that Lamine Yamal must work hard and continue to replicate his Inter Milan performance to reach the level of Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

title: Will a serious focus on health bring horse racing fans back?
content: The Horseracing Integrity and Safety Authority (HISA) has a plan to keep the industry healthy with increased regulations. Will it work?

title: Betting the 151st Kentucky Derby: What you need to know to make a smart race wager
content: The basics and insider intel you need to sound smart while betting the most exciting two minutes in sports.

title: Relevent-USSF settlement: Are foreign leagues coming to America?
content: Settling its suit against U.S. Soccer, Relevent can now bring foreign games to the U.S. Is MLS under threat?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United look to steal Tah from under Barcelona's noses
content: Manchester United are making a move to sign Jonathan Tah from Bayer Leverkusen just when Barcelona thought a deal was done. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Which NFL teams already need a QB for 2026? Reid‚Äôs first-round mock draft has four in the top 10
content: Four QBs in the top 10? Two big trades? Let's make way-too-early predictions for every pick of next year's first round.

title: Rating the rookies for 2025 and beyond
content: Matt Bowen provides his analysis of this year's rookie class in fantasy, in terms of redraft and dynasty value.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Australia polls: PM Anthony Albanese wins historic 2nd term
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is poised for a general election victory, according to media projections, amidst economic concerns and the shadow of Donald Trump's trade policies. Early results indicate a significant swing towards Labor, potentially securing a parliamentary majority. Voters weighed starkly different economic visions, with Albanese emphasizing renewable energy and Dutton advocating for nuclear power.

title: 'CWC is Pak Working Committee': BJP slams Cong over Channi's Balakot remark
content: BJP MP Sambit Patra has strongly criticized the Congress party, labelling its working committee as the "Pakistan Working Committee." This accusation follows Congress leader Charanjit Singh Channi questioning the authenticity of the 2019 surgical strikes. Patra alleges that the Congress is undermining national security and echoing Pakistani narratives, especially after the recent terror attack.

title: Virat Kohli memes break internet for ‚Äòliking‚Äô Avneet Kaur photo
content: Virat Kohli's recent 'like' on an Avneet Kaur fan page sparked a social media frenzy, prompting him to clarify it was an algorithmic error. Despite the online buzz, Kohli remains focused on his performance in the IPL 2025, where he has been instrumental for Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: After PM Modi, Rajnath to skip Russia's Victory Day parade: Report
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is unlikely to attend Russia's Victory Day parade on May 9, with Minister of State for Defence Sanjay Seth expected to represent India. This decision occurs amidst heightened tensions between India and Pakistan following the recent terror attack in Pahalgam. Russia had initially invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the event.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: The banned Chinese smartphone link that NIA is probing
content: The NIA has taken over the Pahalgam terror attack investigation, prompted by the detection of a banned Huawei satellite phone in the area. The attack, which killed 26, is claimed by the Pakistan-backed TRF. Security agencies are working with Western partners to track the device and investigate potential links to foreign entities.

title: India may gain as US-China trade war push automakers to diversify: Report
content: Amid US-China trade tensions, Indian auto component manufacturers may benefit as global OEMs seek alternative suppliers due to rising tariffs on Chinese imports. While the US imposes tariffs on Indian auto parts, a potential bilateral trade agreement by 2025 could enhance India's competitive position. However, escalating trade wars and weakening US growth could pressure discretionary consumption in India.

title: Who is Avneet Kaur? The actress behind Virat Kohli‚Äôs viral Instagram 'like'
content: Virat Kohli addressed social media buzz regarding his alleged "like" on a fan page post featuring actress Avneet Kaur. He clarified that the interaction was likely a mistake due to an algorithm error while clearing his feed, emphasizing there was no intent behind it. Addressing the buzz, Kohli shared a statement via Instagram stories.

title: 'Pot is full ...': Farooq Abdullah calls for uprooting terrorism
content: Following a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah visited the area, assuring tourists of safety and reaffirming Kashmir's integral part of India. He condemned the attack as inhuman brutality, emphasizing the need for unity against terrorism and expressing confidence in overcoming the decades-long violence.

title: How 5 words from Steve Jobs led Salesforce CEO to gift AppStore.com
content: In 2003, Steve Jobs advised Salesforce to build a cloud software ecosystem, inspiring the creation of their app marketplace. Benioff registered a domain for this idea, but later gifted it to Apple after Jobs announced the App Store in 2008. The App Store's success significantly boosted the iPhone's popularity and impacted competitors like Nokia.

title: Virat Kohli's shocking admission: 'I still can't pick him after 15 years'
content: Virat Kohli revealed James Anderson as his toughest Test opponent in England. He also acknowledged Lasith Malinga's ODI prowess and Adil Rashid's challenging spin. In T20s, Sunil Narine's mystery spin proved most difficult for Kohli to decipher. Kohli is currently having a great IPL 2025 season, scoring 443 runs in 10 matches.

title: No more mail, imports or ships from Pak: India slaps slew of bans
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, India has imposed stringent measures against Pakistan, halting all imports and suspending mail services. Pakistani vessels are now barred from Indian ports, and Indian ships are prohibited from visiting Pakistani ports. These actions mark a significant escalation in response to identified cross-border linkages and aim to ensure national security.

title: Sreesanth opens up on 3-year KCA ban, calls Samson 'god's own son'
content: Sreesanth faces a three-year suspension from the Kerala Cricket Association for allegedly making defamatory comments during a TV discussion regarding Sanju Samson's omission from the Champions Trophy squad. Despite the ban, Sreesanth stands by his support for Samson, while the KCA plans to seek compensation from Samson's father and others for alleged baseless accusations.

title: Donate Rs 10 for RCB: Influencers‚Äô QR code experiment for Kohli goes viral
content: An Instagram influencer, Sarthak Sachdevaa, conducted a social experiment capitalizing on the IPL craze by creating a QR code asking for donations for RCB's good luck. Surprisingly, fans contributed, resulting in Rs 1,200 in donations. The video documenting the experiment garnered over a lakh views, with fans playfully hoping their contributions would help RCB win the IPL title.

title: Pakistan says there's 'imminent threat of kinetic action' by India
content: Pakistan has expressed concerns over a potential military response from India following the Pahalgam terror attack, citing intelligence suggesting an "imminent threat of kinetic action." Pakistan's UN ambassador warned that obstructing Indus waters would be considered an act of war, vowing retaliation. On April 24, PM Modi pledged strong action against those responsible for the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Parents catch son, girlfriend eating chowmein, thrash them in public in Kanpur
content: A shocking incident happened in Kanpur. Parents assaulted their son and his girlfriend publicly. The incident occurred at Ram Gopal intersection. Shiv Karan and Sushila disapproved of their son's relationship. They attacked the couple at a street-side eatery. Police intervened and separated the parties. Gujaini police are investigating the matter. Legal action is underway following counseling.

title: 'Aggressive rehna hai': Bumrah's masterclass for RR bowler - Watch!
content: Following Mumbai Indians' dominant victory over Rajasthan Royals, Jasprit Bumrah, known for his exceptional pace bowling, shared invaluable insights with RR's Tushar Deshpande on cultivating a winning mindset. Bumrah emphasised the importance of aggressive thinking, focusing on dismissing the batter rather than solely preventing boundaries.

title: Pakistan flags painted on roads spark tension in Goa
content: Tension escalated in Canacona as Pakistani flags were discovered painted on roads at key locations early Friday, raising concerns about potential communal disharmony. Goa assembly speaker Ramesh Tawadkar filed a police complaint, urging a thorough investigation. Locals questioned the effectiveness of night patrolling, while community leaders appealed for calm. Police are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the culprits.

title: Nobody Can Guarantee Kyiv's Safety If Ukraine Attacks Moscow: Russia
content: Dmitry Medvedev, deputy chairman of Russia's Security Council, said on Saturday that nobody could guarantee that the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv would survive to see May 10 if Ukraine attacked Moscow during World War Two victory celebrations on May 9.

title: Flight Searched In Colombo Over Suspicion Pahalgam Suspects On Board
content: A massive search operation was undertaken at the Colombo airport this noon amid suspicion that suspects in the Pahalgam terror attack had reached Sri Lanka on board a flight from Chennai.

title: Video: Bull Takes A Scooter Ride In Rishikesh, Internet Can't Handle It
content: A stray bull in Rishikesh has taken the Internet by storm after CCTV footage showed it mounting a parked scooter and nudging it forward.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Search Op At Colombo Airport Over J&K Terror Attack Suspects
content: Pahalgam Terrorist Attack LIVE Updates: A special search operation was conducted at an airport in Colombo after a tip-off that six suspects involved in the Pahalgam terror attack were on board a flight.

title: Trade, Shipping, Mail: India's 3-Pronged Measures Against Pak, Its Response
content: In a day of fast-paced developments amid tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack, India has banned imports as well as incoming mail and parcels from Pakistan and barred the docking of ships from the country at all Indian ports.

title: Indian Astronaut's Mission Could Revolutionise Space Travel For Diabetics
content: Indian astronaut, Group Captain Shubanshu Shukla, who will fly to the International Space Station on May 29, will be conducting a key experiment on diabetes during his flight.

title: At World's Largest Crypto Event, Loud DJ, Parade Of Lamborghinis, Pornstar
content: The world's largest crypto event, called Token2049, was held in Dubai at the Madinat Jumeriah Resort from April 30 to May 1.

title: Zelensky Says Ukraine Won't Play Putin's "Games" With Short Truce
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky dismissed a three-day truce ordered by Russian leader Vladimir Putin as theatrics but said Kyiv was ready for a full ceasefire.

title: India Bans All Imports From Pakistan Amid Tensions Over Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: In another strict move against Pakistan, India has banned all imports from the neighbouring country amid soaring tensions over the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 50-Year-Old Man Mauled To Death By Tiger In Madhya Pradesh
content: A 50-year-old man was mauled to death by a tiger in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district on Saturday, a forest official said.

title: Jaguar Land Rover Restarts Car Exports To US: Report
content: Jaguar Land Rover has restarted shipments of vehicles to the United States after pausing them in the face of US President Donald Trump's tariffs, London's Times newspaper reported on Saturday.

title: How Pakistan Used Same Strategy After Every Terror Attack
content: Beyond the barbed wire fences at the Line of Control are terror launchpads that have one routine task: sending terrorists across the boundary into Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Man's Decomposed Body Found Inside House After He Went 'Missing' In Delhi
content: A decomposed body of a 32-year-old man was found inside a locked house in south Delhi's Malviya Nagar area, police said on Saturday.

title: Dinner Parties, Lobbying. What Goes On Behind Closed Doors To Elect Pope
content: It was in the period of pre-conclave huddling in March of 2013 that the dinner table lobbying worked and Pope Francis won on the fifth ballot.

title: "50,000 To 70,000 People Were Present": President Of Goa Temple On Stampede
content: North Goa Superintendent of Police (SP) Akshat Kaushal on Saturday said that we are still trying to determine the exact cause of the stampede incident.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: India bans all imports from Pakistan
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, India has banned all direct and indirect imports from Pakistan, effective immediately. The Directorate General of Foreign Trade announced the decision on May 2, citing national security and public policy concerns.

title: What is Elon Musk‚Äôs five-minute rule for guaranteed success in any field
content: Elon Musk, known for his ventures like Tesla and SpaceX, employs a unique productivity method called the Five-Minute Rule. This involves breaking the day into five-minute slots, each dedicated to a specific task, fostering clarity and accountability. By prioritizing tasks and allocating time intentionally, individuals can enhance focus and achieve greater productivity, mirroring Musk's success.

title: Caught on camera! Nehra's 'secret signals' to Siraj and Prasidh
content: Gujarat Titans defeated Sunrisers Hyderabad by 38 runs in their IPL 2025 match, propelled by Shubman Gill's explosive 76 and Jos Buttler's rapid 64, setting a target of 224/6. Despite Abhishek Sharma's valiant 74, SRH were restricted to 186/6 by disciplined bowling from Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj. This victory elevates GT to second place in the standings.

title: 'Becoming a troubling norm': Supriya Sule slams Air India over delays again
content: NCP-SP MP Supriya Sule has once again criticized Air India for repeated flight delays, highlighting a recent incident where her Delhi flight was delayed twice, leaving passengers stranded. Sule urged Union Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu Kinjarapu to intervene, calling the delays a "troubling norm.

title: India extends $200m defence credit line to Angola
content: Prime Minister Modi and Angolan President Lourenco convened in New Delhi, reaffirming India's dedication to strengthening ties with Angola and the broader African continent. Discussions centered on enhancing cooperation in agriculture, traditional medicine, and cultural exchange. Modi emphasised India's commitment to decisive action against terrorism.

title: ‚ÄòContinues to avoid Manipur‚Äô: Congress targets PM Modi after two years of conflict
content: On the second anniversary of Manipur's ethnic violence, Congress criticizes Prime Minister Modi for allegedly ignoring the state's unrest, highlighting the delayed government response and the ongoing suffering of displaced people. The party points out the Prime Minister's absence from Manipur and questions the effectiveness of the Union Home Minister.

title: 'Born to serve my country': Cop, family spared deportation to Pak after HC steps in
content: Iftkhar Ali, a Jammu and Kashmir policeman, and his eight siblings narrowly escaped deportation to Pakistan after a court intervention. Ali, who has served in the police force for 27 years, believes the deportation notice was a conspiracy stemming from a land dispute. The family's citizenship status remains pending despite being admitted as permanent residents in the late 1990s.

title: 'BJP regime fears questions': CM Stalin slams Centre over press freedom
content: On World Press Freedom Day, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin criticized the BJP-led Union government for allegedly suppressing journalism and diminishing press freedom in India. He highlighted India's low ranking of 151 in the Global Press Freedom Index, accusing the BJP of silencing dissenting voices through raids and imprisonment of reporters.

title: Pakistan claims it successfully tested surface-to-surface missile of 450km range
content: Amid heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terrorist attack, Pakistan's planned surface-to-surface ballistic missile test is viewed by New Delhi as a reckless provocation. Indian officials perceive this as a dangerous escalation, especially with recent ceasefire violations along the LoC. Despite issuing multiple NOTAMs, Pakistan has yet to conduct any missile firings, raising concerns about escalating tensions further.

title: 'If RCB want to win the IPL, they must ...': Former India cricketer
content: Aakash Chopra emphasises the importance of a top-two finish for Royal Challengers Bengaluru to secure their first IPL title, as history favours teams finishing in the top two. While RCB eye a crucial win against Chennai Super Kings to solidify their playoff chances, Chopra urges captain Rajat Patidar to regain batting consistency for a successful campaign.

title: 'Trident of naval power': Indian Navy's showcase of strength
content: Amid heightened India-Pakistan tensions following the Pahalgam attack, the Indian Navy showcased its naval power with a picture of a ship, submarine, and helicopter. While the Dhruv ALH in the image is currently grounded, the Navy's display coincides with extensive drills in the Arabian Sea.

title: Kohli goes down memory lane: When he bagged a Rs 20 lakh contract
content: Ahead of Royal Challengers Bengaluru's match against Chennai Super Kings, ex-RCB skipper went down memory lane to recall the moment and scenes when he and his teammates were picked up by franchises for Rs 20 lakh during the early years of the IPL.

title: Teen girl's body found hanging from tree in Delhi's Japanese Park
content: A teenage girl was found hanging in Japanese Park, Rohini. The discovery occurred early Saturday morning. Police suspect suicide in this case. The girl's identity is currently unknown. Authorities are investigating the scene. Forensic teams are examining the area. The body has been sent for post-mortem. Police are checking missing person reports.

title: PM Modi Announces $200 Million For Mordernisation Of Angolan Armed Forces
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a USD 200 million defence credit line for Angola and expressed commitment to act firmly and decisively against terrorists and their backers, an assertion that came days after the Pahalgam terror strikes.

title: After Imports, Ships Bearing Pakistan Flag Banned From Entering Indian Waters
content: After banning all imports from Pakistan, India on Saturday barred Pakistan-flagged ships from entering any of its ports, following the barbaric attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which took 26 lives.

title: Thane Man Finds Wife, 3 Daughters Dead At Home, Suicide Note Recovered
content: The incident took place in the Bhiwandi area and came to light when the woman's husband returned home after his night shift and found the door closed.

title: Amid Tensions With Pak, PM Modi's "Decisive Action Against Terrorism" Vow
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India is committed to taking "firm and decisive action" against terrorists and those who support them.

title: CIA, NSA to face major layoffs as Trump pushes intelligence reform
content: The Trump administration initiated significant personnel cuts across key US intelligence agencies like the CIA and NSA, aiming to align with national security and budgetary priorities. These reductions, achieved through reduced hiring and early retirement, have eliminated hundreds of positions. Critics, including Senator Mark Warner, warn that these cuts could weaken national security and increase counterintelligence risks.

title: Watch: Moment when stampede broke out at Goa temple
content: A tragic stampede at Goa's Sree Lairai Devi temple during the Lairai Zatra festival has claimed at least six lives and injured 60 others. The incident occurred early Saturday morning as thousands of devotees gathered. Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has assured support to the affected families, while PM Narendra Modi has offered central assistance.

title: Two years of Manipur conflict: Thousands wait to go home
content: Two years after ethnic conflict erupted in Manipur, thousands remain displaced, struggling with lost livelihoods and uncertain futures. G Kipgen, once a coaching institute owner, now worries about his children's future. Abung, a Meitei businessman, yearns for his home. Despite government efforts, deep insecurity and psychological distress persist among IDPs, with civil society demands and armed groups hindering peace.

title: Mangaluru murder case: 8 arrested in killing of Hindu activist Suhas Shetty
content: Karnataka police have apprehended eight individuals concerning the murder of Hindu activist Suhas Shetty. The attack occurred on Thursday night near Kinnipadavu Cross, where Shetty was ambushed by armed assailants. Shetty, who had a criminal record and was implicated in the 2022 killing of Mohammed Fazil, succumbed to his injuries after being hospitalized. Police are investigating the motive behind the attack.

title: 1 dead, 3 injured as speeding Mercedes hits bike, falls off bridge
content: A tragic incident occurred in Pune's Sinhgad Road area early Saturday when a speeding Mercedes collided with a motorcycle on Wadgaon bridge. The impact caused the car to fall off the bridge, resulting in the death of the motorcyclist. The pillion rider and the car's occupants sustained injuries, and the driver has been arrested for culpable homicide.

title: Make Vatican great again? Trump shares AI image after joking about becoming Pope
content: Donald Trump, after joking about becoming Pope, posted an AI-generated image of himself in papal attire on Truth Social, sparking widespread reactions. This occurred as the Catholic Church prepares for a conclave on May 7 to elect a new Pope following Pope Francis's death. Several cardinals, including Parolin, Tagle, Ambongo, Zuppi, and Erdo, are considered potential successors.

title: Pahalgam fallout: Fearing India hit, Pak empties out terror launch pads off LoC
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, intelligence reports indicate that numerous Pakistani terrorists have retreated from the launchpads in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK) to deeper locations within POK and Pakistan. This withdrawal comes amid fears of retaliatory strikes by the Indian forces, reminiscent of the 2019 surgical strikes.

title: Saif Ali Khan to train in Kalaripayattu for hindi remake of 'Oppam'; Filming to begin soon
content: Saif Ali Khan will star in the Hindi remake of 'Oppam'. Priyadarshan will direct the film. Filming will begin by the end of 2025. Saif will play a blind character. He will train in Kalaripayattu for the role. He will take a break to prepare for the role. The original 'Oppam' was a Malayalam thriller.

title: Pakistani singer Abida Parveen's Instagram account banned amid tensions with Pakistan
content: Renowned Pakistani Sufi singer Abida Parveen‚Äôs Instagram profile is no longer accessible to users in India.This move is part of the ongoing restrictions imposed on several prominent Pakistani celebrities following the recent terror attacks in Pahalgam, India.

title: 'If Modi permits, I will go as suicide bomber in war against Pakistan': K'taka min
content: Karnataka Housing Minister Zameer Ahmad Khan declared his readiness to fight against Pakistan, even as a suicide bomber, if permitted by Prime Minister Modi, Amit Shah, and the central government. Khan emphasized his Indian identity and asserted Pakistan's status as an enemy, expressing his willingness to take up arms for the country. He stated his commitment was not a joke.

title: Delhi caught napping! Rain brings the good, the bad, and the ugly
content: Delhi-NCR residents and even the IMD were caught off guard by Friday's intense thunderstorm and heavy rain. The IMD's nowcast failed to predict the storm's severity, with Safdarjung recording 60mm of rain in three hours. The confluence of intense heat, moisture from both the Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal, strong westerlies, and a western disturbance created the potent storm.

title: India suspends Pakistan's I&B minister Attaullah Tarar's X account
content: Amid rising tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack, India has withheld the X account of Pakistan's information minister, Attaullah Tarar, after he accused India of planning military action. This action follows a similar block on Pakistan's defense minister's account and a ban on 16 Pakistani YouTube channels for allegedly spreading misinformation.

title: Prime Minister Modi betrayed people of Andhra Pradesh again, says APCC chief Sharmila
content: At the relaunch of the Amaravati construction works, he repeated the lies he had spoken a decade ago, alleges the Congress leader

title: Nadda chairs special core committee meeting of T.N. BJP in Chennai
content: Mr. Nadda, who was in the city to inaugurate the Sixth International Saiva Siddhantha Conference at SRM Institute of Science and Technology, held discussions with the party‚Äôs national co-incharge for Tamil Nadu P. Sudhakar Reddy, State unit president Nainar Nagenthran, and other senior leaders

title: Police to summon Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi over Pakistan visit, says Himanta
content: Last month, the Chief Minister had asked if the Congress MP had stayed in Pakistan for 15 days and whether his wife gets a salary from an NGO of the neighbouring nation.

title: You have failed to uphold 'Rajdharma': Kharge to PM on Manipur 'no-show'
content: Mallikarjun Kharge said the violence in Manipur began on May 3, 2023 and still continues. Just two days ago, 25 people were injured in a violent clash in Tamenglong district

title: India suspends mail, parcel services with Pakistan through air, surface routes
content: The order suspending the services was issued by the Department of Posts that operates under the Ministry of Communication

title: NEET-UG mock drills underway across centres ahead of May 4 entrance exam
content: The Ministry has said that candidates found indulging in unfair means ‚Äì before, during, or after the examination ‚Äì will be booked under Unfair Means (UFM) and penalised accordingly.

title: PM Modi announces $200 million for modernisation of Angolan armed forces
content: PM Modi made the remarks after holding wide-ranging talks with Angolan President Joao Manuel Goncalves Laurenco that focused on ramping up overall bilateral ties, including in areas of digital public infrastructure

title: Madras High Court issues guidelines to prevent police harassment during criminal inquiries
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan insists on issuing written summons to individuals called for inquiry and recording the minutes in the station diary

title: Bridge across Sharavati backwaters to be inaugurated in monsoon
content: Shivamogga MP B.Y. Raghavendra has requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Minister Nitin Gadkari to inaugurate the project

title: Nepali gang working as domestic help drug elderly couple in Hyderabad, loot 1 kg gold; police issues look out notice
content: Hyderabad police have urged residents to conduct thorough background checks and police verifications before hiring domestic help

title: Eight held in connection with murder of Hindutva activist in Mangaluru

title: What must Liverpool address in summer transfer window?

title: Time for Ryan Garcia and Devin Haney to move on from each other -- for now

title: Inside Quinn Ewers' draft and post-slide motivation
content: Quinn Ewers was in pain, couldn't eat very much, if at all . he had four wisdom teeth extracted, one left an exposed nerve that had him hurting . his agent felt almost assured he would be picked before the last round .

title: Game 7: Key players to watch, final score predictions

title: Western Conference playoffs: Rockets dominate in Game 6

"the interest and excitement surrounding a new Grand Theft Auto has been truly humbling for our entire team," developer said . the next iteration of rockstar's urban crime role-playing game is one of the most hotly anticipated video games of all time .

title: Anthony Albanese's Left-Leaning Labor Party Projected To Win Australia Polls: Report
content: PM Anthony Albanese's left-leaning Labor Party projected to win Australia polls, citing media reports. General election voting has closed in Australia's populous eastern states, such as Sydney and Melbourne, with just two more hours of voting left. Per opinion polls,¬†Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's Labor Party has a narrow lead over the conservative party.¬† Results of the poll could start coming in two hours after polls close. According to analysts,¬†Albanese has run a solid campaign while opposition leader Peter Dutton has suffered from policy missteps and a perceived ideological closeness to Trump, which has become a top concern for voters, per a report by Reuters. The¬†Australian Broadcasting Corporation also said that¬†opposition leader Peter Dutton is set to lose his seat in the federal election.
